core_criteria: Does not contain added vitamins, minerals, artificial flavoring agents, or food additives.
Has not had any constituent removed or significantly changed (except for the removal of water).
Has not been submitted to 'maximum processes' that significantly alter its original physical, chemical, or biological state (e.g., bleaching, chemical extraction).
allowed_processes: Minimum processes (e.g., chopping, grinding, pasteurizing, freezing, smoking without chemicals)
rules.flavoring: Natural flavors derived from plant or animal sources are permitted.

rules.core_criteria: The food must meet the requirements of Kashruth (Jewish dietary laws).
restricted_terms: Any symbol implying the food is kosher (if requirements not met)
rules.style_claims: Terms like 'Kosher style' or 'Kind of Kosher' legally imply the food is kosher and must meet Kashruth requirements.

proof_requirements.what_proof: Certification by a Rabbi or Rabbinical organization.
proof_requirements.location: Typically displayed as a symbol or mark of the certifying Rabbinical organization on the Principal Display Panel (PDP) or near the product name.

rules.core_criteria: The food must be certified as Halal by a certifying person or body.
restricted_terms: Any symbol implying the food is Halal (unless certifying body is indicated)

proof_requirements.what_proof: The name of the person or body that certified the food must be written on the label. Using only a logo or acronym is insufficient if not easily recognizable.
proof_requirements.location: Can appear on the label, package, or in advertisements. Must be present to validate the claim.

sub_categories.name: Homemade
sub_categories.rules: Describes a food that is not commercially prepared. Cannot be used for foods prepared in a commercial establishment.
sub_categories.proof_restrictions: Commercial products must use qualified terms like 'Homemade style' or 'Home-style'. Using 'Homemade' for commercial products is likely misleading.

sub_categories.name: Artisan Made

rules.method: Traditional and rudimentary methods involving significant manual labor and limited automation.
rules.ingredients: Additives/preservatives limited to those found in a common household kitchen (e.g., vinegar, salt, sugar).

sub_categories.proof_requirements: No specific proof statement required on label, but manufacturing method must be substantiatable if challenged.

content_levels.permissions: May be labelled as 'Organic' and use the Canada Organic Logo.
May state 'Contains X% organic ingredients' on the label. Cannot use the 'Organic' claim for product name or logo.
May only identify organic ingredients within the list of ingredients. Cannot make any organic claims on the main panel.

what_proof.certification_body: Name of the certification body is required for any product claiming >70% organic.
what_proof.logo: Canada Organic Logo is voluntary but permitted only for >95% organic content.

location.certification_body_name: Usually placed near the organic claim or logo.
location.imported_products: Must have 'Product of [Country]' or 'Imported' in close proximity to the Canada Organic Logo.
